Hanoi city's interdisciplinary force
has just inspected and discovered nearly 1 ton of
food of unknown origin that
does not ensure quality at a
production facility in Dong Anh district. It is
noteworthy that the number  These foods are
snacks that are being sold in front of the
school gate and are very popular with students.
These are more than 100 kg of human eye-shaped candies,
a type of marshmallow that is
loved by children. They are purchased floatingly
on the market.  There is no inspection or
origin. However, the owner of the facility has processed and
packed them into plastic boxes and then
placed cool labels on the raw materials
of the goods, which does not show the name
of the production unit. It is a drift product.  floating
on the market, so we are
determining that these raw material sources
are goods with no
origin for these products and have not yet been
established and will not announce the quality of
the products from now on.  Until the Lunar New Year, the
functional forces will strengthen
inspection and control of
production and business establishments, especially
related to food hygiene and safety issues,

according to the indictment.  The incident occurred on the evening of
May 23 at the home of the
two brothers' parents in Ward B, Tuy
Hoa City, where the defendant had a conflict with his
brother, Tran Nhat Minh, because he was
scolded until about 10 p.m.  On the same day, angry,
Tan came home with a knife and went to his

brother when his brother repeatedly hit
Tan's face. He immediately pulled back and stabbed him

He then went to the police and surrendered, the

Australia China warns of snow
this week Tropical jasper strikes

in a state of emergency  Power outages in natural
disaster areas may face
significant flooding. Meteorologists say the

Hotels must close. Meteorologist

coming hours. Queensland Deputy Premier Stephen

China's National Meteorological Administration
has just activated the second level emergency response warning
in the four-level scale of severe cold
and Bao Tuyet.
This week, most localities in Northern
China will have heavy snowfall and
plummeting temperatures.  Since December 13, this is
considered one of
China's coldest Decembers in decades. It is
predicted that this weekend the temperature
in the capital Beijing will drop to the lowest level of
-1 degrees Celsius while the
Average Mid-December in Beijing is
usually around -8.
Beijing Capital International Airport is still operating but
train services are forced to suspend from
December 13 all schools in
Beijing  also temporarily closed and
classes moved online.
Businesses were also asked to allow
employees to work flexibly and with
staggered travel times. This week's cold weather is in
stark contrast to normal times.  The
autumn-like weather a week
before the first snow of the season made
many people excited while
local authorities had to mobilize
maximum force to clean up to
minimize accidents and reduce traffic congestion.
Museums in the US are organizing a

rich Christmas traditions from around the
world Christmas
around the world exhibition at the Museum of Science  and
Chicago Industry includes a

more than one
tree and displays all

different cultures around the world.  The
great thing about this exhibition is that it really
shows how similar we all are
especially in
times where we may have some
differences. The exhibition originated in
1942 when the museum  The museum invites communities to come
decorate a Christmas tree with only one
new tree decorated
every day for 12 days to showcase the
countries that fought alongside the United States in
World War II.  The
Chicago Museum of Science and Industry's World Tour
lasts until January 7
